items.text: wide of off, and Mushfiqur chops down at it to add another single to third man
items.postText: Mahneel Musa: "@Jai, 'Mahmud' almost made me think you want Mahmudullah out of the XI, our only back to back world cup centurion, the man for the big occasion "
items.shortText: Tiripano to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: It's been 28 deliveries since the last boundary.
items.text: aimed right up at his toes, and Kayes chips his flick out into the leg side for a single.
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: Mushfiqur steps confidently forward at a full ball, but he's into his drive before the ball has quite got to him and can only find mid on
items.shortText: Tiripano to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: Tiripano's return to the attack has been a relatively accurate one, and he keeps Mushfiqur quiet with another length delivery on off stump.
items.shortText: Tiripano to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: there's a push into the covers, and a single results as Raza scurries across but can't quite stop it cleanly.
items.postText: Tushar: "Liton has improved his game so far while Imrul has been in good form. Imrul is a senior player too. I prefer Liton and Tamim as opening partner. Imrul can be a great back up. Soumya has many shots to play, but unfortunately he is out of form. Though he is coming back, maybe he can be the no. 3 if he is in good form. I don't want Mithun to open. Mithun is good in middle order. That means I don't see Sabbir coming back in the squad in future. I also don't know how Mr. President thinks! "
items.shortText: Tiripano to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.preText: Masakadza has kept himself in at slip as Raza continues.
items.text: this starts a little too wide of off stump, and Mushfiqur eases a single to short third man
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: looped up on off stump, and there's a bread-and-butter single down to long off
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: interesting variation from Raza! I don't think this was a leg break, but it pitched and left the batsman, beating his cut.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: floated up, the regulation offspinner this time, and Mushfiqur defends
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: swept, in the air but in the gap and over the fielders inside the circle on the leg side. There's a man out in the deep to keep them to one
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: very full, almost a yorker on his toes, and Kayes jabs a single down to short fine leg.
items.postText: And that will be drinks in Chattogram. With Bangladesh needing just 80 from 20 overs with eight wickets in hand, you've got to think they've pretty much got this one in the bag. Chayon: "@jai, No matter what happens "Tamim, Shakib, Mushfique, Mahmudullah & Mashrafe" are auto choice, if they are fit to play. BD will build around these 5. They are called "poncho pandob" here."
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: He starts with a slower bouncer that balloons up and past Kayes' pull
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: dropped! Tiripano is livid. Kayes hasn't been nailing his pull strokes in the last half hour or so, and he pulls this in the air and to the right of Mavuta at midwicket. But he drops it, and they scamper through for two. Is the ball a little wet? The fielder pulls his cap down over his head in shame. It's hard work for bowlers on this wicket, and harder still if your fielders don't back you up
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, 2 runs

items.text: on a length, outside off, and he glides to gully
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: firmly punched off the back foot, and deep extra cover keeps them to one
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: Mushfiqur loses his balance flicking this into the leg side, running and then tumbling forward. But he recovers quickly enough to complete the run
items.shortText: Tiripano to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: whipped with plenty of bottom hand into the leg side, but it's cleanly stopped at midwicket.
items.postText: A chance goes begging for Zimbabwe. How might that wicket have changed the dynamic here?
items.shortText: Tiripano to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: cool as you like, Mushfiqur skips out and sends the ball arcing cleanly over wide long on. He got right to it and followed through beautifully
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Mushfiqur Rahim, SIX runs

items.text: Raza holds this one back, flighting the ball right up, and it grips and turns in to Mushfiqur as he cuts late to short third man
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: short enough for Kayes to hang right back in his crease and thump a single out to deep extra
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: very full on off stump, and he steps into a drive out into the deep
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: eased down to long on, and Bangladesh tick closer to a series win
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: floated up well wide of off, but Mushfiqur misses with his dab
items.postText: One can't help but feel that Zimbabwe have been a little deflated by that dropped chance.
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Williams replaces Tiripano, and it's time for a little left-arm spin.
items.text: speared down wide of off from around the stumps, and Kayes cuts very late down to third man. Chatara hares after it and times his dive well to flick the ball back into play and save a run
items.shortText: Williams to Imrul Kayes, 3 runs

items.text: flat and fast from Williams, and Mushfiqur is struck on the thigh aiming a glance into the leg side.
items.shortText: Williams to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run
